dc:title: From Union Square to Rome Dorothy Day 1938, Chapter 12, pp. 143-151. Answers the question as to how she rejected Communism. In spite of Communism's good ideals and the faults of Christians, she repudiates Communism as a heresy and rejects its resort to violence in class struggle.
